version_description:
Apple Watch support for messaging, incoming call-handling and call and message settings
Active notifications for calls, messages and voicemails

Improved reliability associated with inbound calls and messages
Minor bug fixes for the Apple Watch

- Added Line2 Apple Watch Glance
- Minor bug fixes

- Improved Line2 call handling during primary line incoming call
- Updated contact search logic
- UI improvements and bug fixes

- Messaging improvements
- Minor iOS 9 related improvements

* Improved picture and group messaging
* Larger image previews in message threads
* Minor bug fixes

* Improve image capture for iPad
* Minor bug fixes

* Added ability to invite people to Line2 using iOS Sharing
* Minor bug fixes

- Ability to block a number from call history on iPhone and iPod touch
- Minor bug fixes

* More reliable incoming call and message notifications
* Ability to block a number from call history on iPhone and iPod touch
- In your recent calls list, swipe left on any entry to block or unblock all calls/messages from that number

* Updated Line2 iPad app
* Enables Split View app multitasking on supported iPad devices
* Provides Slide Over functionality to quickly interact with a second app on supported iPad devices
* Adds number blocking to iPad interface - simply slide call history record to the left and choose block

* Addressed issue associated with playing voicemail messages
* Minor bugs fixed relating to message display layout
* Improved iPad handling of message images
This update improves call answering on iOS 10 while we finalize an upcoming version with CallKit

* Enhanced read/unread message statuses to be live across all devices.
* Improved CallKit experience with better mute button behavior and quiet ringer functionality.
* Expanded Bluetooth support. (We'd love to hear how Bluetooth is working for you. Let us know by going to Settings -> Help -> Email Our Support Team within the Line2 app.)

For any and all questions, please go to support.line2.com.

Improved call reliability for iPhone users with paid accounts:

• Audio alert if poor data coverage during a Line2 call. Enable at Settings -> Advanced -> Network Quality Alert (off by default)
• Ability to chose VoIP or cellular voice for Line2 calls. Enable at Settings (Data is default). This replaces “Use Cellular Data”and “Use Cellular Voice” from Settings
• You can turn off cellular data for Line2 on phone Settings -> Cellular -> Use Cellular Data For Line2
• Call notification improvements
• Minor bug fixes
Addressed issue associated with calling when you upgrade the app

Improved Line2 messaging
- Increased media attachments to up to 1MB
- iOS sharing of images from iPhone Photos
In-app purchase for annual subscription - Get 2 months FREE with an annual subscription!
Audio improvements when receiving a second phone call
New Line2 logo - tell us what you think!

* iPhone X support
* Send iPad Instant Markups via Line2 MMS

* Enhanced inbound call reliability
* Improved iPhone X support
* Minor bug fixes
Release notes: Updated to allow listening to uninterrupted external music while messaging, and additional bug fixes.
Now send animated GIFs! We have enhanced messaging with GIF support.
Updated in app purchase flow for Line2 annual subscription
Thank you for choosing Line2!  This update includes bug fixes and performance improvements that increases the reliability of inbound calls and messages.

Improving your business communications. We fixed audio selection for incoming calls, app rating prompt linking directly to reviews, and splash screen logo. The Line2 Watch app has been removed from this release but you will still get Line2 notifications on your Watch.

Thank you for choosing Line2. With this release we’ve addressed a few minor bugs and added new features to improve the experience for users with multiple Line2 phone numbers:
•Include up to 5 different lines and manage them seamlessly in the Line2 app.
•Easily navigate between your various phone lines while keeping all communications separate.
•Name and color code each line individually to easily identify who is calling or messaging which number.
•You can even add numbers you use from other Line2 accounts to your one app!

Thank you for choosing Line2. With this release we’ve addressed a few minor bugs and added new features to improve the experience for users with multiple Line2 phone numbers:
• Include up to 5 different lines and manage them seamlessly in the Line2 app.
• Easily navigate between your various phone lines while keeping all communications separate.
• Name and color code each line individually to easily identify who is calling or messaging which number.
• You can even add numbers you use from other Line2 accounts to your one app!
• Now copy/paste phone numbers into the dialer.
• Improved inbound calling reliability.
The Line2 app has been updated to improve inbound call reliability, message notifications and addressed a few issues associated with Bluetooth headsets.
The Line2 app has been updated to improve inbound call reliability, message notifications and addressed a few issues associated with Bluetooth headsets.
The Line2 app has been updated to improve call reliability and addressed a few smaller issues.

Thank you for choosing Line2. We have enhanced the service so that people with paid Line2 subscriptions now have access to e911 and 711.

• e911: Go to Settings -> Accounts, select the account and enter your Emergency Address and you are all set if you should ever need to call 911. You can change the Emergency Address on file whenever you need to.
• 711 TRS: The Telecommunications Relay Service (TRS) permit persons with a hearing or speech disability to use the telephone service. Simply dial "711" to be automatically connected to a TRS operator to assist you with your call.
• Calling: Improved call reliability while changing data networks.

Thank you for choosing Line2. We have been working hard on some new improvements!

• Improved dialer screen.
• Updated voicemail display.
• Bug fixes and stability enhancements.

Thank you for choosing Line2! This update includes an improved login and purchase experience, as well as general bug fixes and stability enhancements.

Fixed an issue where contacts would not load after first granting permission.
